alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:22PM CDT until June 16 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene, Hale, Marengo, Perry, Sumter and Tuscaloosa. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 722 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Demopolis, Livingston, Eutaw, York, Greensboro, Cuba, Moundville, Forkland, Akron, Boligee, Union, Gainesville, Epes, Newbern, Emelle, Thornhill, Allison, Walden Quarters, Tishabee and Wedgeworth.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
